reviewText: Inside of a unknown land of North Korea. It's movie reproduce a real life that, unfortunately, is the North Korean live.

This is probably the most emotionally painful film I've ever seen.
It is also one of the most artistic, beautiful, even. The cinematography at the end, the symbolism, the shots with rain/light... worth watching for that alone. Really worth watching. If you don't want to shell out the bucks, its on youtube.
An epic of courage and redemption - a truly inspiring love story crossing two very different worlds - North and South Korea.

This is an excellent movie on some of the issues relating to North Korean human rights.  It is very sad.  And while you might question some of the movie's plot as only a tear-jerking method, I would encourage you to read books and first-hand accounts of North Korean testimonies the subject.  I would suggest "The Eyes of the Tailless Animals" or "The Aquariums of Pyongyang."
